title: How to Make Quick Berry Jam

steps.headline: Sterilise the jam jar by washing them thoroughly using hot, soapy water.
steps.description: Dry the jars in a slow (120ºC) oven for 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Wash and hull the berries if needed.
steps.description: Place the berries and sugar into the pan.

steps.headline: Stir over medium heat until the sugar dissolves completely.
steps.description: Bring the liquid to a boil, then reduce the heat. Do not cover the liquid, and leave it to simmer for 12–15 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove the jam from the heat and leave to cool slightly.
Pour the jam into the jar and seal.
Store opened jar in fridge and consume within two weeks of opening.

text: Sterilise the jam jar by washing them thoroughly using hot, soapy water. Dry the jars in a slow (120ºC) oven for 20 minutes. Wash and hull the berries if needed. Place the berries and sugar into the pan. Stir over medium heat until the sugar dissolves completely. Bring the liquid to a boil, then reduce the heat. Do not cover the liquid, and leave it to simmer for 12–15 minutes. Remove the jam from the heat and leave to cool slightly.  Pour the jam into the jar and seal.  Store opened jar in fridge and consume within two weeks of opening.  Finished.
